description.p: Tangram is a new kind of browser. It is designed to organize and run your Web applications. Each tab is persistent and independent. You can set multiple tabs with different accounts for the same application.

ul.li: Stay up to date with your favorite communities; Mastodon, Twitter, ...
Merge all these chat applications into one; WhatsApp, Messenger, Telegram, ...
Group your organization tools under one application; EMail, Calendar, ...
One-stop for multiple sources of documentation or information
Fix a bug preventing to add new tabs
Notifications priority is normal instead of urgent by default
Add a per-tab setting to change notifications priority
Fix authentication on many popular websites
Fix Cancel button in tab settings dialog
Use middle-click or Ctrl+click to open links in the browser
Fix window title
Update GNOME runtime to 41
Fix an issue preventing some sites such as Twitter or Facebook from being added.
Update GNOME runtime to 3.38
Enable spell checking
Customizable user-agent per instance
New project icon/logo
New tab background color respects dark mode
Add support for downloading files
Add home button
Better desktop integration
Fix the main window becoming tiny when unmaximizing
Enable touchpad/touchscreen swipe navigation gestures
Better notifications handling
Improved web compatibility and performances
Tangram now works properly on Flatpak 1.0 (Linux Mint, Ubuntu 18.04, ...)
